ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: great
Basic knowledge about the operating system.
I learned about operating systems
operating system skill
os skills
I learned about operating systems as well as caches and memory management.
I gained a conceptual understanding of many important topics in operating systems, like scheduling algorithms and file systems.
PrinciplesOf Operating Systems: Operating-System Design and Implementation, Process & Thread, Process Synchronization, Deadlocks, Memory Management, Storage Management, File System.

- developed insights into core concepts in operating system design
- the ability to write distilled program to test and illustrate specific key ideas (multithreading, scheduling etc.)
- the ability to connect historical developments in the field to current conventions
- familiarity with the key algorithms in the area (scheduling, deadlock avoidance, concurrency, etc.)
Several aspects of Operating Systems such as the System Organization, Architecture, File Management, Multiprocessing, Multithreading, Syncrnoizations, and many more.

What an operating system is, processes and threads, different scheduling algorithms, the critical selection problem and some solutions, deadlocks and how to prevent/avoid them, virtual memory, mass storage systems, the file system interface and implementation, and protection.
os
basics of operating systems
I gained a good overview of how operating systems work, building on the material from CPSC 323 by going into more details.
Basic OS concepts.
This is a good course. I learned a lot of fundamental stuff for OS.
Operating Systems
Operating System
A basic understanding of Operating systems
The course focuses on concepts in OS. It's useful in a job interview.
Knowledge of Operating systems
Knowledge about operating systems
Basic principles of OS.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: everything great
breadth of content
Strenghts: Avi is a great teacher. Weaknesses: Unresponsive on Ed but overall great course.
I enjoyed the breadth of topics covered in the class.

Strengths: clear slides with examples, useful homework and test.
Weaknesses: no

The strengths are clearly the material and the instructor. The focus on concepts over programming techniques is unique and essential. This course could benefit from having programming assignments instead of timed exams, however.  Although a programming-heavy course would be very different from this one.

Strengths: The Professor is highly experienced. The course organization was great. The times when the exams were planned was perfect.

Weakness: The written portion of the exams (just the definitions) seemed a little like a memory game since we had to memorize them.

The PSETs were comprehensive and the slides/textbook were a really great resource and super thorough. It was tough to attend class because of the time, but the lectures were recorded, which was super helpful. This is very much so a concept heavy class that will test your ability to memorize information rather than strictly coding skills/PSETs.
Cannot think of any weakness
This course if great so far.

pro:good foundation knowledge of computer
con: more exercise would be better for understanding
All good
The course was ok

strengths: The are recordings of each course, and the slides are good material to catch up even if we miss the course. 
weakness: I think there are too many conceptual questions in the exams and the assignments.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you want to learn about operating systems take this course
yes
yes
Incredibly easy CS credit
I would recommend if that student is interested in operating systems.
I would recommend this course for anyone who is not entirely familiar with the implementation of operating systems and would like to gain a conceptual understanding.
Yes.
Yes. This is for the student who wants to develop deeper insights into the why's of operating system design.
Yes, this course is a great introduction to the concepts of Operating Systems.
I would recommend this class if you're looking for a slightly deeper dive into operating systems after 323. The workload isn't too bad and the material is interesting.
I would if you haven't covered OS in detail during 323 or want to get a more detailed overview than what 323 otherwise gives.
Yes. A reasonable workload which covers important concepts about OS.
Yes. This is an essential course for all CS major students
yes. basic computer science course help you better understand
Yes
Yes, it is a great course for those who have no knowledge about operating systems. The problem sets are carefully designed so that you can use the knowledge from the lecture in a flexible way.

Yes if you just want an easy course and it's a GPA booster.
Note that you won't learn implementation details in an OS. But you will learn many concepts if you are new to OS.
Yes
Yes if you haven't taken this required course.
